thread.title: West York head coach, Jeremy Jones takes on former team
thread.title_full: West York head coach, Jeremy Jones takes on former team

title: West York head coach, Jeremy Jones takes on former team
text:
West York head coach, Jeremy Jones takes on former team 
Updated: 
Posted by: Shannel Douglas 

YORK -- West York head football coach, Jeremy Jones is preparing to take on his former team, York Suburban nearly a year after taking on his new role leading the Bulldogs. 

Jones replaces Ron Miller who stepped down after the 2014-2015 season. But Jones is no stranger to the Bulldogs. The new head coach was a part of Miller's staff back in 2008 and continued teaching at West York even after he left to coach at other schools, including York Suburban. 

"I had a lot of those kids started as sophomores for me so I'm happy for them," explains Jones. "I know they've been working hard for the past two or three years and I'm glad they're where they are." 

This will be the first time Jones will be taking on his former team as a Bulldog. 

"We're going to go out and do the best that we can." said Jones. 

"It's kind of bittersweet going up against him," says Dajour Henderson, York Suburban's Running Back. "It's going to be an exciting game. I know he's getting his guys ready for the game and we're over here getting ready too." 

Kick off is set for 7 pm at West York for their homecoming game.
